name: VendorLeadTime
description: Contains the planned and actual lead times from the vendor.

fields.name: connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the data source (i.e. connection). Auto populated by Galaxy.

fields.name: product_group_id
fields.description: Vendor lead times can be set at product group level; product level values will overrde these

fields.name: site_id
fields.description: Vendor lead times can be set at company's site level - these override region or company level values

fields.name: region_id
fields.description:
Maps to company's geographical region aka geo_id.

Vendor lead times can be set at company's region level - these override company level values

fields.name: planned_lead_time
fields.description: Planned lead time from vendor into Company's site

fields.name: planned_lead_time_dev
fields.description: Optional: standard-deviation of lead time, assuming Normal distrbution

fields.name: actual_lead_time_mean
fields.description:
Optional: Actual values of lead time computed based on transactional data (mean, standard-deviation, p50 and p90 values). These not only provide a handy comparison, but can also be used for planning or insights. Will need to be updated at periodic intervals for the effective dates
 
Debate: Should we store this in output table, and report on that? Or make this data available within VLT tables so as not

fields.name: actual_p90
fields.description: Inbound shipping cost from vendor to Company

fields.name: shipping_cost
fields.description: Inbound shipping cost from vendor to Company

fields.name: we_pay
fields.description: Whether Company pays for inbound shipping or vendor pays. This is an optional field that is relevant when incoterm is not used on PO..

fields.name: db_creation_dttm
fields.description: Internal audit field - stores when the record was created

fields.name: db_updation_dttm
fields.description: Internal audit field - stores when the record was last updated

fields.name: sap_eina__infnr
fields.description: Number of purchasing info record. Predicate key for SAP mapping. Upsert key for  EINE
